identificationModule.briefTitle: Efficacy of Folrex in the Superior Extremity Rehabilitation After Acute Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Efficacy of Folrex in the Superior Extremity Rehabilitation After Acute Stroke

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of the study is to evaluate whether Folrex, could improve the motor recovery of the upper extremity after stroke in comparison with placebo during 4 weeks of treatment.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Periodical measures of the motor recovery, of the upper extremity, by Fugl-Meyer score, it will be done at the beginning, at fifth day and at month. Each value will be compare to evaluate whether the groups of patient improve.

armGroups.label: Placebo
armGroups.description: In this group we will use Placebo cream, in the early rehabilitations in the upper extremity

armGroups.label: Folrex
armGroups.description: In this group we will use Folrex cream, in the early rehabilitations in the upper extremity

interventions.name: Folrex
interventions.description: Folrex cream, in the early rehabilitations in the upper extremity, before daily rehabilitation

interventions.name: Placebo
interventions.description: Placebo cream, in the early rehabilitations in the upper extremity, before daily rehabilitation

primaryOutcomes.measure: Periodical measures of the motor recovery, of the upper extremity, by Fugl-Meyer score, it will be done at the beginning, at fifth day and at month (4 weeks).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients with acute stroke \< 24 hours.
* Patients with impairment up to 4 on NIHSS scale.
* Family support.
* Informed consent.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Presence of another disease not well controlled.
* Patient with dementia.
